intro: Oritrophium limnophilum subsp. nevadanum, commonly known as the Nevada heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, violet to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its composite flower heads. Its subspecific name, *nevadanum*, reflects its geographic distribution within Nevada.
